CatDescriptText: Mr. James Crawford, 3359 McNeil Place, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1957, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that parents should be imprisoned for the unlawful acts of their children (under 18 years of age)?" answer reads: "No, because it seems that in some cases, although the parents give the best to their children, the kids still go wild. Sometimes the kids go bad regardless of what you do for them.  In the case of negligence of the parents, however, I think that something should be done to the parents."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Crawford wearing light colored fedora with dark band and plaid shirt, standing on Fifth Avenue in front of Meyer Plumbing and Heating, Soho
